title: Pablo Laso
text:
Pablo Laso Biurrún (born October 13, 1967) is a Spanish professional <a href="basketball">basketball</a> <a href="head%20coach">head coach</a> of the <a href="Real%20Madrid%20Baloncesto">Real Madrid basketball team</a>, and a former professional player.
Professional playing career.
Club career.
Laso played 17,378 minutes (4th most) in 624 games (9th most) in the <a href="Liga%20ACB">Liga ACB</a> (the <a href="Spanish%20basketball%20league%20system">top-tier level Spanish League</a>). He holds the ACB records for <a href="ACB%20stats%20leaders%23Liga%20ACB%20all-time%20assists%20leaders">most career assists</a> (2,896) and <a href="ACB%20stats%20leaders%23Liga%20ACB%20all-time%20steals%20leaders">most career steals</a> (1,219).
He won the <a href="1995%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">1995 edition</a> of the <a href="Spanish%20Basketball%20King%27s%20Cup">Spanish Cup</a>, and won the Most Valuable Player award of the tournament. He also won the championship of the <a href="FIBA%20Saporta%20Cup">FIBA Saporta Cup</a>'s <a href="1996%E2%80%9397%20FIBA%20EuroCup">1996–97 season</a>.
National team career.
Laso played in 61 <a href="cap%20%28sports%29">games</a> with the senior <a href="Spain%20men%27s%20national%20basketball%20team">Spanish national team</a>. He played at the <a href="EuroBasket%201989">EuroBasket 1989</a>, the <a href="1994%20FIBA%20World%20Championship">1994 FIBA World Championship</a>, and the <a href="EuroBasket%201995">EuroBasket 1995</a>.
Professional coaching career.
In 2008, Laso led <a href="Gipuzkoa%20BC">Bruesa GBC</a>, to achieve a league <a href="promotion%20and%20relegation">promotion</a> to the Spanish top-tier level <a href="Liga%20ACB">Liga ACB</a>.
Laso led <a href="Real%20Madrid%20Baloncesto">Real Madrid</a> to win the <a href="EuroLeague">EuroLeague</a> championships of the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Euroleague">2014–15 season</a>, and the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Euroleague">2017–18 season</a>. He also led Real Madrid to win 4 <a href="Liga%20ACB">Spanish League</a> championships (<a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20ACB%20season">2013</a>, <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20ACB%20season">2015</a>, <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20ACB%20season">2016</a>, <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20ACB%20season">2018</a>), 5 <a href="Spanish%20Basketball%20King%27s%20Cup">Spanish Cups</a> (<a href="2012%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2012</a>, <a href="2014%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2014</a>, <a href="2015%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2015</a>, <a href="2016%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2016</a>, <a href="2017%20Copa%20del%20Rey%20de%20Baloncesto">2017</a>), and 4 <a href="Spanish%20Basketball%20Supercup">Spanish Supercups</a> (<a href="2012%20Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">2012</a>, <a href="2013%20Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">2013</a>, <a href="2014%20Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">2014</a>, <a href="2018%20Supercopa%20de%20Espa%C3%B1a%20de%20Baloncesto">2018</a>).
He also led Real Madrid to win the championship of the <a href="2015%20FIBA%20Intercontinental%20Cup">2015 edition</a> of the <a href="FIBA%20Intercontinental%20Cup">FIBA Intercontinental Cup</a>.
